meanings.sent1: Peroxidations can lead to damage in cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study peroxidations to understand their effects on the body.
meanings.sent3: The peroxidations in the experiment went out of control, turning the solution bright red!
meanings.sent4: The peroxidations in the body are like tiny explosions causing harm.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration vividly showed how peroxidations occur in nature.

meanings.sent1: Careless handling of chemicals can result in peroxidations.
meanings.sent2: The peroxidations in the lab were due to a spill of reactive substances.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student's prank led to unexpected peroxidations in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The peroxidations caused by the faulty equipment were a serious safety hazard.
meanings.sent5: The peroxidations caused by the mixing of incompatible substances were clearly visible.

meanings.sent1: The dark spots on the fabric were the peroxidations from the bleach.
meanings.sent2: The peroxidations on the metal surface indicated prolonged exposure to oxygen.
meanings.sent3: The chef's accidental addition of too much oil resulted in interesting peroxidations in the dish.
meanings.sent4: The peroxidations on the old painting gave it a unique, weathered look.
meanings.sent5: The peroxidations on the leaves showed the effects of environmental factors on plants.
